Api¶

crefor.api.add_child(parent, child)¶

Add a child guide to parent guide

Parameters:
  • parent (str) – Parent guide child will be added to.
  • child (str) – Child guide that will be added to parent.
Return type:

crefor.model.guide.Guide

Example:

>>> add_child("C_arm_0_gde", "C_spine_0_gde")
# Result: Guide(C_spine_0_gde) #
crefor.api.create(position, description, index=0)¶

Create a guide.

Parameters:
  • position (str) – L, R, C, etc
  • description (str) – Description of guide
  • index (int) – Index of guide
Returns:

Guide

Example:

>>> create("C", "spine", index=0)
# Result: Guide(C_spine_0_gde) #
crefor.api.has_child(parent, child)¶

Is guide an immediate child of parent?

Parameters:
  • parent (str) – Parent guide child will be added to.
  • child (str) – Child guide that will be added to parent.
Return type:

bool

Example:

>>> has_child("C_spine_0_gde", "C_arm_0_gde")
# Result: True #
crefor.api.has_parent(child, parent)¶

Does the child have parent anywhere in it’s hierarchy?

Parameters:guide (str, Guide) – Guide that will checked
Return type:bool

Example:

>>> has_parent("C_root_0_gde")
# Result: False #
crefor.api.is_parent(child, parent)¶

Is guide the immediate parent of child?

Parameters:
  • parent (str) – Child guide that will check for parent
  • child (str) – Parent guide that will check for child
Return type:

bool

Example:

>>> is_parent("C_spine_0_gde", "C_arm_0_gde")
# Result: True #
crefor.api.remove(guide)¶

Remove guide from scene

Parameters:guide (str, Guide) – Guide to be removed

Example:

>>> remove("C_arm_0_gde")
>>> cmds.ls("C_arm_0_gde")
# Result: False #
crefor.api.remove_parent(guide)¶

Remove guides parent if available

Remove guide from scene

Parameters:guide (str, Guide) – Guide to be removed

Example:

>>> remove_parent("C_arm_0_gde")
>>> cmds.ls("C_arm_0_gde")
# Result: False #
crefor.api.set_parent(child, parent)¶

Set child guides parent.

Parameters:
  • parent (str) – Parent guide child will be added to.
  • child (str) – Child guide that will be added to parent.
Returns:

Parent guide

Example:

>>> set_parent("C_arm_0_gde", "C_spine_0_gde")
# Result: Guide(C_spine_0_gde) #
